snippet: The 31-year-old successor to Jon Stewart as host of “The Daily Show” told a joke that was similar to one written by another comedian. But the moral dividing line can be hard to determine.
abstract: Jason Zinoman Critic's Notebook recounts allegations of joke-stealing aimed at Trevor Noah, latest controversy surrounding South African comic since he was chosen as Jon Stewart's successor on The Daily Show; notes that even if some truth lies in accusations, Noah's other qualifications could make him perfect host for show.
lead_paragraph: The 31-year-old successor to Jon Stewart as host of “The Daily Show” told a joke that was similar to one written by another comedian. But the moral dividing line can be hard to determine.

headline.main: ‘Daily Show’ Successor Trevor Noah Finds Himself Catching Criticism, Not Dealing It Out
